user_management

Class Restaurant

  • java.lang.Object
    • user_management.User
      • user_management.Restaurant
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Observable

    public class Restaurant
extends User
implements Observable, java.io.Serializable
    Implementation of Restaurant, extends the lUser class. It has a menu, the worth of total sellings, and lists of full meals, half meals and single items. Implements the Observable interface. A restaurant can send notifications to customers thanks to an observer pattern.
    Author:
    maxspahn, jeremyaugot
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Restaurant

                  java.lang.String userName,
                  java.lang.String passWord,
                  java.lang.String phone,
                  java.lang.String email,
                  int[] adress)
        Constructor. By default, the restaurant has a total selling worth of 0, and a discount equals to 10%.

        public void setMealOfTheWeek(java.lang.String mealName)
                      throws ItemDoesNotExist
        Set the meal of the week.
        Parameters:
        mealName - String which contains the name of the meal.
        Throws:
        ItemDoesNotExist - if mealName does not exist in the menu of the restaurant.

      • createNewFullMeal

        public void createNewFullMeal(java.lang.String fullMealName,
                              java.lang.String starterName,
                              java.lang.String mainDishName,
                              java.lang.String dessertName)
                       throws WrongItemAdded,
                              ItemDoesNotExist
        Create a new full meal.
        Parameters:
        fullMealName - String which contains the name of the full meal to create.
        starterName - String which contains the name of the starter to add to the menu.
        mainDishName - String which contains the name of the main dish to add to the menu.
        dessertName - String which contains the name of the dessert to add to the menu.
        Throws:
        WrongItemAdded - if there is already an item of the same type.
        ItemDoesNotExist - if an item does not exist in the menu of the restaurant.

      • createNewHalfMeal

        public void createNewHalfMeal(java.lang.String halfMealName,
                              java.lang.String mainDishName,
                              java.lang.String secondItemName)
                       throws WrongItemAdded,
                              ItemDoesNotExist
        Create a new half meal.
        Parameters:
        halfMealName - String which contains the name of the half meal to create.
        mainDishName - String which contains the name of the main dish to add to the menu.
        secondItemName - String which contains the name of the second item to add. It can be a starter or a dessert.
        Throws:
        WrongItemAdded - if there is already an item of the same type.
        ItemDoesNotExist - if an item does not exist in the menu of the restaurant.

      • createNewItem

        public void createNewItem(java.lang.String itemType,
                          java.lang.String name)
                   throws WrongItemAdded
        Create a new item.
        Parameters:
        itemType - String which contains the type of the item: a fullMeal, halfMeal, a starter, mainDish or a dessert.
        name - String which contains the name of the item.
        Throws:
        WrongItemAdded - if there is already an item of the same type.
